intro: Psychotria deflexa, commonly known as the "Cape Cod psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria deflexa is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its uses.
